Posts.Content: May 9, 2009 06:47PM Kimberley30 wrote: I totally feel you on this. I have seen people since I have been diagnosed more up my ass lately then ever. Why do I have to go thru something so terminal to be loved and get attention?? I want to know as well, when do you fall out of the denial stage. I am getting my whole breast removed, and I requested an implant right after. My nipple has cancer so that has to go for sure!! How do you go on after this? I am a single mother w/ 2 kids. How am I going to meet my special someone when I feel mutulated??
Posts.Title: When does it feel real? PS73 Makratz

Posts.Content: May 11, 2009 09:21AM Kimberley30 wrote: PS73,  I totally agree hun, your husband will have the best gift of all.. YOU!! Your love will overcome all of it! I wish you the best, and God will see you through all of this!
Posts.Title: When does it feel real? PS73 Makratz

Posts.Content: May 9, 2009 01:52PM Kimberley30 wrote: Hello All,  My name is Kim, I am 30 years old. I was just diagnosed with breast cancer myself. I am a non smoker, with noone in my family that has had cancer. my Dr has no clue where this came from. I had atleast 7 mamagrams, and 1 biopsy before it was detected. I started to bleed from my nipples, that is what made me notice it, and bring the issue to the doctors.  My Dr has now told me I need to have my breast removed, and get reconstructive surgery. I am trying sooooooooooooo hard not to break down and cry. I am trying to smile as though I wasnt just told this. I guess the reason for this site is to hear how other people are coping & dealing.  I hope and pray that we all with get through this from the help of God, our families & friends. May God bless us all!! Love Kim
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed DebeDawn Kimberley30

Posts.Content: May 9, 2009 05:40PM Kimberley30 wrote: My Dr is a general surgeon. She is great. I am afraid there isnt much time for another opinion. This has been ongoing since Oct. 2008. I have had so many mamagrams and a biopsy. She is a GREAT surgeon, and I trust her quite well. She did my biopsy, and is very throuogh with me. I am hearing impaired, so she draws the issue for me, to ensure I understand. I feel like I can trust her opionion! Thanks for the feedback ladies, it is always amazing to hear someones in take!!
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed DebeDawn Kimberley30
